definition: to rub or roll between the hands or fingers/to twist

sentences.english: Do not rub frostbitten areas or apply direct heat.
sentences.chinese: 不可揉搓凍傷區域或直接加熱。

sentences.english: I rub eyes, a beautiful wife in another sofa.
sentences.chinese: 我揉搓着眼，妻子張美麗就在另一個沙發上。

sentences.english: He is scared of the sound of plastic bags crumpling .
sentences.chinese: 它很害怕揉搓塑料袋發出的悉悉索索的聲音。

sentences.english: Remove everything inside. Then wash the fish in clean water and rub salt into them.
sentences.chinese: 然後，在清水中清洗魚，並將鹽揉搓進魚內。

sentences.english: Rub it into all areas, including under the fingernails .
sentences.chinese: 揉搓整個手，包括指甲縫下面。

sentences.english: Avoid rubbing or pressing on your eye.
sentences.chinese: 請不要因此而揉搓或按壓您的眼睛。

sentences.english: He bent over and rubbed his sore ankle.
sentences.chinese: 他彎下腰去揉搓發痛的腳踝。

sentences.english: He rubbed his hands to keep them warm.
Mechanical use of hammer-type structure, and rub crush-style principles.
sentences.chinese: 採用錘片式結構，揉搓粉碎式原理。

sentences.english: Then genty rub and rinse off with clean water.
sentences.chinese: 然後輕輕揉搓，用清水沖洗。

sentences.english: Dissolve a few aspirin in a bit of water then rub into the stain.
sentences.chinese: 將少許阿斯匹林溶於少量水中，然後揉搓到汗漬上。

sentences.english: The fat and flour are rubbed together with the fingertips as for pastry.
sentences.chinese: 像做油酥麪糰那樣用指尖把脂油和麪粉揉搓到一起。

sentences.english: Pump into hands, lather vigorously, rinse and dry.
sentences.chinese: 壓出泡沫得到中，揉搓泡沫，沖洗晾乾。

sentences.english: Massage the scrub in for a good five minutes for best results.
sentences.chinese: 輕輕地揉搓上5分鐘效果最好。

sentences.english: Rub the ointment well in the skin.
sentences.chinese: 揉搓軟膏使其滲入皮膚。

sentences.english: This kind of bag named Hot Club will heat quickly after rubbing.
sentences.chinese: 這種叫做“熱棒”的小袋揉搓一下後就會發熱。

definition: to rub or roll between the hands or fingers/to twist
to pat/to slap/(of a bird) to flap (one's wings)
to paint/to smear/to apply (makeup etc)/to doodle/to erase/to obliterate
to moisten/to dampen/to be steeped in/to be imbued with
to clean (with water or alcohol)/to wipe and wash/to swab/to scrub
